description:
As Service Delivery Manager, you are a business partner to our finance and business stakeholders. You exhibit impeccable commercial judgment, regularly engage with our outsourced provider management, Head of Industries and Directors across Google to balance cash, cost and customer satisfaction.

You will work to ensure the highest level of quality from our outsource provider; ensuring process adherence, monitoring key performance indicators and collaborating with Process Managers to proactively minimize operational risk.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in financial or technical/operational discipline or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience managing an outsourced provider.
  • Experience in leading outsourced teams around process excellence, support excellence, operations and customer service.
  • Ability to lead complex internal and external stakeholder management.
  • Understanding of key collections metrics.
responsibilities:
• Closely monitor and provide regular updates on service level agreements and key performance indicators.
  • Partner with Collections Global Process Managers to provide process feedback to optimize the customer experience end to end.
  • Partner with Collections Global Process Managers to review and implement process changes.
  • Act as a point of contact for high profile and complex escalations in your regions.
  • Lead the team and deliver impact around areas such as: reducing delinquent and aged days sales outstanding; reducing friction for our customers, most frequently reflected in customer and sales satisfaction surveys; improving operational productivity; operational effectiveness.
title: Service Delivery Manager
